title: OIDC: Backchannel logout not being called when using Sign out all Session in Keycloak
body: ### Describe the bug Hi, 1) When I try to use the "Sign out all sessions" on a client in Keycloak it appears the back-channel endpoint is not being called. If I individually sign each session out in the UI Keycloak calls my server and the user is logged out. But nothing happens when I click the `Confirm` button. Is this by design? 2) Also, when the backchannel logout endpoint is called, is there a way to have Quarkus automatically redirect to a specific page? This works for the normal logout method of defining a `/logout` url in the `application.properties` and I'm redirected to whichever page I want after the user manually initiated the logout. Just wondering if there is a way to get the same behavior using back-channel as well. Keycloak Version: 22.0.3 Quarkus: 3.4.1 ### Expected behavior I would think the users would be logged out via the backchannel logout as it is for a single user. ### Actual behavior _No response_ ### How to Reproduce? _No response_ ### Output of `uname -a` or `ver` _No response_ ### Output of `java -version` _No response_ ### GraalVM version (if different from Java) _No response_ ### Quarkus version or git rev 3.4.1 ### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`) _No response_ ### Additional information _No response_
